New Records: The Cavs' 136 points are the most the team has ever scored in a season opener, surpassing the previous mark of 133 points set in the 1988-89 season.
The 136 points are also the most the Cavs have ever scored in a non-overtime regular season road game.
Key Match Events: Evan Mobley led the game with 25 points, nine rebounds, three blocks, and two steals.
Donovan Mitchell contributed 21 points, three assists, three steals, and one block.
Caris LeVert led the bench with 19 points and four assists.
The Cavs shot 58.6% from the floor and 46.7% from three-point range, making 14-of-30 from deep.
The Cavs scored 30+ points in all four quarters.
Pre-Game Insights: Cavs head coach Kenny Atkinson texted Caris LeVert about his multifaceted role this upcoming season, preparing him for various roles including starting or coming off the bench.
Post-Match Reflections: Jarrett Allen emphasized the importance of both defense and offense in their win, noting the team's focus on spacing with the offense.
